title: Tension - string attached to stationary block

content.question: A light string is attached to a heavy stationary block on a rough surface. When a person pulls the other end of the string with a horizontal force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, the block remains at rest. Which of the following indicates where along the string, if anywhere, the tension has a magnitude of <math alttext="the fraction F sub 0, end sub, over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> and provides a correct justification?

choices.label: The tension is <math alttext="the fraction F sub 0, end sub, over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> in the middle of the string because the tension along the length of the string varies linearly from zero at the block to <math alttext="F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> at the person.

The tension is <math alttext="the fraction F sub 0, end sub, over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> in the middle of the string because the leftward and rightward tension forces both act on half of the string length at this location.

There is no location along the string where the tension is <math alttext="the fraction F sub 0, end sub, over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> because the tension has a magnitude of <math alttext="F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> at any location between the person and the block.

There is no location along the string where the tension is <math alttext="the fraction F sub 0, end sub, over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> because the block remains at rest.

content.answer: There is no location along the string where the tension is <math alttext="the fraction F sub 0, end sub, over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> because the tension has a magnitude of <math alttext="F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> at any location between the person and the block.
